venue.name: Boston Public Library/ Rabb Lecture Hall

item.description:
The Never-ending Skyscraper Phenomenon
"Exploring Design," the Boston Society of Architects' lecture series
at the Boston Public Library

Carol Willis, the founder, director and curator of The Skyscraper Museum in New York City, examines the extraordinary proliferation of skyscrapers worldwide and the cultural and architectural significance of this phenomenon.

Admission is free. They recommend arriving about 15 minutes before the presentation starts.

We will not be going out after since not enough people are going, but we can plan to do this for the December lecture.
item.name: The Never-ending Skyscraper Phenomenon
